title: Prawns with freshly grated coconut, green chillies and mustard seeds (Chingri daab)
description: This is a popular dish in Bengal, where of course both prawns and coconut abound. It’s normally served in a whole green coconut there, but that’s a bridge too far for us. I would suggest serving it, as in Bengal, as a little course in its own right, but it’s also delicious with some rice and flatbreads.
ingredients: 250g/9oz fresh or frozen coconut flesh, blitzed in a food processor or grated
4 fresh green chillies, with seeds, cut lengthways into sixths
